column4: hmmm i have been installing ubuntu for about an hour now and the screen  turned black with one underscore just sitting at the top left of the screen, is this supposed to happen?
Install shouldn't take a whole hour.. at least.. I think not.
but it is just sitting there, can't hear it writting data any more, should I reboot
Yeah, you might need to.  Did you burn the CD you're installing from?
Did you burn it at the highest speed your burner can use? I had issues with burning install discs at high speed. Causing errors I think.
not sure burned at default speed

Hmmm. If you restart the install, and hit escape while it's asking you questions about your setup, you'll get a menu. You can scroll down, and near the bottom, there'll be a menu item for testing the install disc. It'll check to see if the disc is error-free.
That was the only problem I had with installing Ubuntu.. I had errors on the disc, so I made sure to burn the disc sloooww.  2x or 3x.  That seemed to fix it.
No problem. :)  I hope that that solves your issue. Welcome to Ubuntu!
if there is a problem will it just stop at one point at the disc and keep spinning and sound like its aobut to overheat?
I'm honestly not sure. But it seemign to totally freeze is a pretty good sign that something went wrong. :(
sorry to bother ya again, just scanned it and it said the cd was fine...?

Well, if it said that, and it freezes on install at the same point every time, you'll have to find someone more knowledgable than me. One thing I did to verify that my burned copy was good was to rip an ISO image off of the disc... take an md5 sum of that ISO, and compare to the MD5 of the iso I'd burned from.  If they matched, the burn was absolutely perfect.
will do ty
Sorry that it's been an ordeal. It was for me too, but when I finally got it installed.. I never looked back, and I totally switched to Ubuntu from Windows. :)
That's odd. There shouldn't be a root user in Ubuntu.  Did you choose your personal user name as root?
I think so not really, sure have been through this 4-5 times now
yes
It should've brought you right into GDM. odd.
was messing around and umm I logged and it says I now have mail, with the prompt :joey@ubuntu:~$
Ohh. Try typing startx
Beyond my current scope of expertise.
